description: The Dijon food transition initiative, launched in 2018, aims to transform the local food system in response to deindustrialization. The project focuses on collaboration among various stakeholders, including industry leaders and political figures, to create a sustainable agricultural and consumption model. Despite challenges such as funding changes and the impact of COVID-19, the initiative continues to evolve, emphasizing the importance of local networks and political engagement in driving successful transformation.
